I'm well, thank you. Just finished reading a fascinating book about Tolstoy and his influence on Russian national identity.
Tolstoy! Ah, a classic. What did you think of the book?
It was very insightful. It really explored how his works reflected the social and political climate of his time.
Absolutely. His writings definitely offer a window into the soul of Russia. What about Dostoevsky?
Dostoevsky is incredible! His explorations of faith and human nature are timeless.
I agree. Have you read "Notes from Underground"?
Yes, it's one of my favorites. So dark and complex.
It's a masterpiece. Do you think these authors are still relevant today?
Oh, definitely. Their themes of human struggle, faith, and social change transcend time and place.
